title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" imposes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to lower tax rates. The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" reduces individual income tax rates for different income brackets, with varying percentages and thresholds. The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" reduces individual income tax rates for different income brackets, with varying percentages and thresholds. A tax is imposed on the taxable income of every head of a household according to a specified table. The tax rates for different income brackets under the "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25, plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45, plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20, plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20, plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. These rates apply to unmarried individuals (other than surviving spouses and heads of households). The tax rates for unmarried individuals (excluding surviving spouses and heads of households) under the "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" are determined based on specific income brackets. Tax rates for unmarried individuals under the "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" are based on income brackets. For taxable income not over $25,750, the tax is 13.5%. For income over $25,750 but not over $62,450, it is $3,476.25 plus 25.2% of the excess. For income over $62,450 but not over $130,250, it is $12,724.65 plus 27.9% of the excess. For income over $130,250 but not over $283,150, it is $31,640.85 plus 32.4% of the excess. For income over $283,150, it is $81,180.45 plus 35.64% of the excess. Married individuals filing separate returns have different tax rates. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to a tax on their taxable income as per a specific table. The tax rates for taxable income vary based on specific thresholds, with percentages ranging from 13.5% to 35.64%. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to these tax rates as per a specific table. The tax rates for taxable income of estates and trusts are determined according to a specific table. The tax rates for taxable income of estates and trusts are determined according to a specific table. Tax rates range from 13.5% to 35.64% based on different income brackets. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change various years from 1992 to 1998 in different sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change various years from 1992 to 1998 in different sections, including sections 220(g)(2), 221(g)(1)(B), 512(d)(2)(B), 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), 685(c)(3)(B), 877(a)(2), 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II), 2032A(a)(3)(B), 2503(b)(2)(B), 2631(c)(1)(B), 4001(e)(1)(B), 4261(e)(4)(A)(ii), 6039F(d), 6323(i)(4)(B), 6601(j)(3)(B), 7430(c)(1), 42(h)(6)(G)(i), and 132(f)(6). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change various percentages, including 15 percent to 13.5 percent, 28 percent to 25.2 percent, 39.6 percent to 35.64 percent in different sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change percentages in different sections, such as 15 percent to 13.5 percent, 28 percent to 25.2 percent, and 39.6 percent to 35.64 percent. Effective dates for these amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Amendments to withholding provisions made by subsection (c) apply to amounts paid after December 31, 1998.
